isis.stitle: CAB: 7000 AND 8000 SERIES MODELS - REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION - Electric Windshield Wiper Motor

caution.para: Do not attempt to grasp the wiper blades or arms while they are in motion. Attempting to stop the arms or blades in motion may result in component damage. If blades are frozen to the windshield, thaw them out before attempting to operate.

note.para: The electric windshield wiper motor has no serviceable parts or adjustments and is replaced as a complete unit.

step1.para: Turn the ignition key to the ON position and cycle the wiper arm to the end of the sweep cycle (wiper blades will be in the vertical position). Turn key to OFF position.

note.para: Graphic view is from the backside (or cab side) of unit.

step1.para: Disconnect electrical connector from the electric wiper motor. Remove wire ties as needed.
Remove nut and lock washer securing wiper drive arm to electric wiper motor.
Remove three mounting bolts securing electric wiper motor to the mounting bracket.

caution.para: Do not attempt to grasp the wiper blades or arms while they are in motion. Attempting to stop the arms or blades in motion may result in component damage. If blades are frozen to the windshield, thaw them out before attempting to operate.

note.para: The electric windshield wiper motor has no serviceable parts or adjustments and is replaced as a complete unit.

step1.para: Install the electric wiper motor on the mounting bracket and secure with three mounting bolts ( Figure 68, Items 3, 4, and 5). Tighten to 44 to 62 Lbf-in. (5 to 7 N•m).
Install nut and lock washer securing wiper drive arm to electric wiper motor ( Figure 68). Tighten to 104 to 140 Lbf-in. (12 to 16 N•m).
Connect electrical connector to the electric wiper motor. Replace any previously removed wire ties ( Figure 68, Items 2 and 5).
Turn the ignition key to the ON position and cycle the wiper arm to the end of the sweep cycle (wiper blades will be in the horizontal position). Turn key to OFF position.
Turn wipers on high speed, activate windshield washer, and check for proper wiper operation. If required, adjust windshield wiper arm and blade assembly.
